reviews.text: This hotel is clean, modern, and fairly new. It's very convenient to shopping, restaurants, and has super quick access to the highway. The staff is friendly and helpful, there's free parking, and a free breakfast in the morning (get there early or it will be packed). Only downside, if you want to take a swim - it has the tiniest indoor pool I've ever seen! Also it sits very close to the highway and is a bit noisy - ask for a room facing the mall instead.
reviews.title: Clean, convenient, good stay

reviews.text: This is a very nice location, great quality of rooms and ammenities. My situation: I had a four night stay that ended on Oct 1. There was a Hilton promotion that ended on Sept 30th. I was just looking to see if there was a way to still qualify for the double point promotion that ended on Sept 30th even if I was there until Oct 1. OK, maybe I didn't deserve the double points because I didn't meet the criteria it just would have been nice for someone in mgmt to have been honest and told me that. Instead I got the constant run around from the front office staff:
reviews.title: Good facility, really poor mgmt follow thru

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This Hilton was amazing. Absolutely beautiful hotel, wonderful staff. Excellent breakfast spread in the dining room every morning. We had a King Suite. Beautiful, immaculate room! The bed is absolutely to DIE for! Never slept in anything like it. Crisp white linens, TONS of wonderful down pillows, beautiful lush down comforter with suede duvet. Fit for a queen. Really hated to get out of bed every morning. Beautiful decor and carpets. Very modern furniture. The entire suite was immaculate. Could have eaten off the bathroom floor. I'm a stickler for cleanliness in a hotel room and this place was pristine! They call you in your room asking if you need anything a few times after you get settled. If you need anything, they are there immediately. We were treated like royalty at this hotel. If in St. Louis, you won't be disappointed in your stay here. Worth MUCH more than we had to pay. Very quiet, friendly, awesome service, immaculate in every respect. I will definitlly be back time and time again. The only thing I would change is that they have no room service. Had they had it, I would have never left the room! Do yourself a big favor, stay at this hotel. What a treat!
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

reviews.text: I live in Chicago and travel weekly for work, though I grew up in St Louis nearby this hotel and normally stay with family, I had a family funeral to attend and the house had other guest so we stayed here. I originally had a reservation at the Hilton Frontenac which I stayed at in October of 2010 as my family was out of country. That hotel is old, and the feeling is very dowdy to say least. This property was my first time at a Homewood, I normally stay Hyatt Place or Marriott Courtyards when in suburbs of cities in the midwest. I was impressed, this hotel location is just excellent, the rooms are huge, had a 1 Bed suite, w kitchen, and the free breakfast gets the 5 star award for full buffet thats got something for everyone. Its a brand new property as well, so you feel as if your this first person to stay in rooms. The beds are super comfy too. 2 Flat Panel HD TV's is nice, one in each room, We had family over before the services as the funeral home was nearby Ambruster.
reviews.title: The best value in Clayton/Ladue area, excellent rooms.

reviews.text: You cant go wrong if you want an apartment feel and first class service. Nice job Hilton, travel is always nicer with a property like this. Free internet and free computers too!
reviews.title: Nice and new, but with just a few flaws.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My friend and I stayed at this Homewood Suites in the area of Clayton, MO for a long weekend getaway in January 2011. Upon first impression, the hotel is extremely nice. It appears new, or newly remodeled (not sure which, from the lobby to the room. The mini kitchen area is very nicely decorated, as is the sitting room. The bedroom is also very nice, although neither my friend or I enjoyed the mattress very much. There's a nice vanity area outside of the bathroom which is also very nice. The only area that seemed to have missed the renovation was the bathroom itself. That seemed much more basic and standard, and maybe even a little dirty (shower curtain). Also it would've been nice to have a working fan in the bathroom because it got extremely hot in there when showering! The location of the hotel is great in that is very close to many shops and restaurants. However, it is right next to an expressway, which can be very noisy at night. I would suggest that you ask for a room away from the expressway. The hotel's pool is pretty tiny, although it is nice that they have a pool at all. Also enjoyed the hot tub!
reviews.title: Worth a visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our four-day stay started out poorly, marred by finding a maintenance worker in our room when we checked in and a very chaotic fire alarm and evacuation (sort of) minutes later. Things soon settled down and went smoothly from then on. The good things: The price was right. The King Suite had lots of room, a comfy bed and a well equipped kitchen. Wireless is easy to access and fast. There's an outstanding fitness center--far beyond the two-treadmills-and-an-elliptical you usually see. It has everything my local Y has except a running track. Staff throughout the hotel look for ways to be helpful, but the breakfast staff really shines. The bad things: The suites need a place inside the door to hang coats; even a coat rack would help. The locale is busy and congested with fast-moving traffic. While there are some excellent restaurants in the general area (check out the many options in Clayton's downtown several blocks to the north) there aren't many within walking distance.
reviews.title: Great Hotel ! Enjoyed our stay 100%

reviews.text: Our family of five along with other family members stayed at this hotel over the July 4th weekend. The staff especially Michael and Jackie were very helpful. They offered great suggestions for things to do and places to eat in the area. The hotel is in a wonderful location. Shopping across the street and easy access to the Metrolink for downtown adventures was a bonus.
reviews.title: Great Stay-friendly staff-Perfect for families

reviews.text: The Suite-Start breakfast was well-stocked and had very good variety. The hotel is located on a major road so there is some traffic noise, but it was not too bad.
reviews.title: Very Nice - Good Service

reviews.text: The layout of the room is perfect for families-- with two TVs and a small kitchen. It was also helpful to have laundry facilities on every other floor.
reviews.title: worst customer service.....ever!!

reviews.text: I had some business in the Clayton area and this was one of three hotels I had to choose from. After doing some research I decided on staying at the Homewood Suites so I could earn my HHonors points.
reviews.title: staff was top notch and extremely friendly

reviews.text: The hotel is new and has that "new hotel" smell to it. Rooms are very relaxing and nice. Staff couldn't have been friendlier! Even the cleaning crew engaged in conversation. The nightly reception was great and again, the service was top notch. It is also close to some nice shops and great restraunts!
reviews.title: Great place to come home to
